intro: Calystegia pellita subsp. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf calystegia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Convolvulaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a hairy texture, while the stems are hairy and often twining. This subspecies is native to parts of North America, particularly in the southeastern United States. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks.
